thread.section_title: Business & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Fiat Chrysler Chief to Focus on UAW Talks; Ford, Union Agree to Extension
thread.title_full: Fiat Chrysler Chief to Focus on UAW Talks; Ford, Union Agree to Extension - WSJ

author: Jeff Bennett
title: Fiat Chrysler Chief to Focus on UAW Talks; Ford, Union Agree to Extension
text:
1 COMMENTS Negotiations between the United Auto Workers union and the Detroit auto makers intensified Monday as Fiat Chrysler Automobiles FCAU -1.65 % NV’s chief headed to Detroit and Ford Motor Co. agreed to continue talking beyond the midnight deadline.
Fiat Chrysler Chief Executive Sergio Marchionne canceled his appearance at the Frankfurt Motor Show this week to focus on bargaining after the UAW picked the auto maker as the target company on Sunday.
The UAW hopes to craft a new contract with Fiat Chrysler that will also serve as a template for Ford and General Motors Co. GM 1.89 %
Mr. Marchionne has said since the start of the talks in July that he would lead the final negotiations. The company declined further comment on the talks.
UAW Vice President Norwood Jewell, in a message to Fiat Chrysler members, said the union continues negotiating.
“Although we have been meeting for months now, there are still many items of importance to be reconciled,” Mr. Jewell said in the message. “The current four-year contract is due to expire tonight. It is our goal to structure a new agreement for your approval.”
Ford and the UAW officially signed an agreement Monday to extend their bargaining beyond the midnight deadline. Workers continue to operate under the 2011 rules until a new contract is reached.
GM is likely to make the same contract extension.
Write to Jeff Bennett at jeff.bennett@wsj.com
